data.title: Replace the Ace editor with the Monaco editor
data.body:
This PR replaces the Ace editor with the Monaco editor from Microsoft.

Major changes:
- Replaces the Ace editor with the Monaco editor
- Adds live syntax checking for TypeScript and JavaScript
- adds live semantic syntax checking for TypeScript
- adds completions for JavaScript and TypeScript based upon code in project and d.ts files
- adds hovers for variables/methods in TypeScript and JavaScript
- adds parameter help for functions in TypeScript and JavaScript
- replaces the TurboBadger editor with Monaco editor with whitespace displayed (syntax highlighting, however, is not available.  A new grammar would need to be created, but if done could provide completions as well.)
- Supports application prefs for font size, themes ( vs or vs-dark supported), display whitespace, soft tabs, and tab size

data.title: Atomic API Docs: in some cases search leads to a 404 page
data.body: In the Atomic API Docs site, if you hit enter on a search before the "Preparing Search Index..." message goes away, then an invalid page will get loaded.  Probably need to figure out if there is a way to not try to navigate until the index is populated, or create some kind of promise that waits until the index is fully loaded.  The index itself may need to also be looked at to see if there is a better way to load it.  This starts moving into the TypeDoc code itself, so if we find a solution, we may want to PR it back to them.

data.title: TypeScript: Compile results improvements
data.body:
There needs to be some improvements to the compile results that are emitted when doing a full compile of TypeScript.  This is kind of a catch all, but could be broken out into separate issues if necessary.
- The compile log should make the errors hyperlinks so by clicking them, an editor will load and scroll to the line with the error
- The compile log should be docked in a hide-able window and not in a modal so that it's possible to navigate to multiple errors
- If there are any errors in compilation, the associated files in the navigator should be annotated with some kind of error indicator

data.title: segmentation fault 11 when closing editor tabs
data.body:
Periodically, the editor will crash with:
`25101 Segmentation fault: 11` when closing editor tabs.  It appears that a tab may be getting duplicate close messages or allows for re-entrancy because it seems to happen when clicking the X on the tab the first time, but the editor doesn't close.  Clicking the X the second time will then cause the crash.  This doesn't happen when closing the tabs all of the time, but it does happen pretty frequently.

data.title: Editor UI - Need new menu item - Close All Files
data.body: When a bunch of tabs are open, it would be nice to have a Close All Files menu item.

data.title: Release and Debug APK's
data.body: This PR implements everything in and closes #844. It has been tested for Android deployment on Windows, OSX, and Linux.  Thanks to @JimMarlowe for the quality work 👍

data.title: Embedded web view does not recognize changes to WebBrowserHost.SetGlobalStringProperty
data.body: The embedded web view only ever gets the initial value on a property set via WebBrowserHost.SetGlobalStringProperty.  If the host changes that property, the embedded web view still only sees the initial value.  Closing and re-opening the web view will allow it to see the updated value.

data.title: Added Import Materials option to ModelImporter and Inspector
data.body:
Added a config flag to "ImportMaterials"  in Settings\Import.json to disable/enable auto generating materials on model import. (Enabled by default)
Also added a check box to the model inspector allowing the user to enable/disable whether that model should generate or regenerate materials on apply or import.

data.title: Build Improvements
Change the default Atomic logo used in deployed apps
Improvements to CMake generation bash and bat scripts
Andriod toolchain for debug and release apks from #844
data.body:
This is the result of the proposal in #844. Everything in #844 was implemented, in addition to the OK and Cancel buttons on the Build Settings dialog perform their assigned functions. This gives a fairly wide path for users to deploy both debug and release APKs from the editor. The build processing changed very little, and the error messages have been enhanced to tell what the problem is and to give possible fixes, in some cases. The release APKs are done by the user modifying ant.properties to include the keystore location and the passwords, so the build process does not need to be stopped to enter these, and since the directory where the user keeps this file is set into ToolPrefs, they only needs to do it once.
I need help testing it on windows and OSX, I can not build on these platforms.
And when it lands, the wiki page can be updated to reflect the new capabilities.

data.title: Linux keyboard mapping for 884
data.body: This fixes the most of the keys for Linux cef3 usage, by translating SDL keycodes into Windows keycodes, as that is what cef3 requires. It fixes #884 and #872.

data.title: [Linux] keyboard mapping issues in script editor
data.body: This fixes #884 and #872 by mapping most of the keys on the keyboard to the windows standard.

data.title: Addressing Linting issues
Jakefile needs to build linux libAtomicPlayer.so
data.body: The same problem exists on linux as did windows with PR #312, it needs to build the  androidPlayerBinary otherwise an android apk can be build successfully, but crashes on an android device because the libs/armeabi-v7a/libAtomicPlayer.so is missing.

data.title: Research Linux distribution via Flatpak
data.body:
A new technology called [Flatpak](http://flatpak.org/) has been [announced](http://flatpak.org/press/2016-06-21-flatpak-released.html) which might be able to solve some of the issues around releasing the Atomic Game Engine on different Linux distributions.  It's aim is to provide a single distribution package that runs on different environments by bundling in the dependencies.

> From the very start its primary goal has been to allow the same application to run across a myriad of Linux distributions and operating systems.

Research needs to be done to determine how best to bundle up the Linux distributions of the Atomic Game Engine with Flatpack, figure out what distributions are supported, identify if there are any licensing restrictions, and determine if the builds can be automated.

data.title: Updating README.md with Q&A site information, adding BACKERS.md
Updates build to automatically generate script bindings with single cmake invocation
[Linux] keyboard mapping issues in script editor
data.body:
When using the script editor some keyboard keys behave strange when running on a build post 13th of June with the new CEF (was able to get around the editor crash using 'export MALLOC_CHECK_=1' as suggested by @CTrauma).

L = up
K = left
J = home
H = end
G = page down
F = page up
X = insert
C = delete

This behavior does not happen when running a build pre 13th of June when the old version of CEF.

data.title: Factoring AtomicNET Prototype 2 out of sources
data.body: ... for a clean run

data.title: Mismatched case in "require" calls causes built player to crash
data.body:
It appears that if you require in a file that doesn't explicitly match the case of that file, it causes the generated player to exit without logging any errors.  

so, for file: `customModule.js`,
if you use

```
var customModule = require('custommodule');
```

but

```
var customModule = require('customModule');
```

works.

It will work if you launch the player from the `play` menu button, but as soon as you build out an executable and try to launch it, it will simple exit immediately without writing an error to the log.  I think proper casing should still be required, but the following probably needs to happen
1) both the editor and generated player should handle it the same way and enforce strict casing
2) the generated player should log some kind of error message to the console instead of failing silently

data.title: Fix for user provided modules starting with "Atomic"
data.body: This fixes the issue where a module starting with "Atomic" pulls from the wrong location if it is not a built-in file.

data.title: Silent crash on player if a "required" module starts with "Atomic"
data.body:
If a your code tries to require in a module starting with `Atomic` and it's not one of the built-in modules, the player fails.  If launched from the editor, an error is displayed that the file could not be found.  If launched from a built player, the player just crashes silently and doesn't log any errors.

```
var myModule = require('Atomic-helper-routines');
```

will fail.

data.title: Windows HLSL cache issue on binary installation
data.body: The HLSL cache folder cannot be created or written to on Windows when installed, unless run as administrator.  Disable the cache for the editor install or pregenerate these files files on the CI box

data.title: TypeScript enhancements
data.body:
This PR adds some additional overloads to make some APIs work better as generics so that the resulting return value is auto-cast to the right type.  Namely:

```
ResourceCache.getResource<T>
ResourceCache.getTempResource<T>
ResourceCache.getExistingResource<T>
UI.getWidgetAt<T>
UIWidget.getWidget<T>
```

The other thing this PR does is allow for `export default <classname>` which is used in `ES6` and `TypeScript` which closes #845.  The project templates have been updated to use `export default` for the `TypeScript` projects as this is a cleaner and more preferable way of doing things.

@JoshEngebretson can you double check the C++ changes?  They work, but I'm still getting my bearings in C++ and there could be a better way of handling that.
